snippet: As fighters with ISIS bore down Tuesday on the Turkish border, President Obama’s plan to fight the militant group without being drawn deeper into the Syrian civil war was coming under acute strain.
lead_paragraph: As fighters with ISIS bore down Tuesday on the Turkish border, President Obama’s plan to fight the militant group without being drawn deeper into the Syrian civil war was coming under acute strain.
abstract: Pres Obama's plan to fight Islamic State group without being drawn deeper into Syrian civil war comes under acute strain as militant fighters bear down on Syrian town of Kobani on Turkish border; Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan says country will not get more deeply involved in conflict unless United States agrees to give great support to Syrian rebels.

headline.main: Turkish Inaction on ISIS Advance Dismays the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Turkish Inaction on ISIS Advance Dismays the U.S.

snippet: The president of Turkey is weakening the fight against the Islamic State by engaging in cynical political calculations.
lead_paragraph: The president of Turkey is weakening the fight against the Islamic State by engaging in cynical political calculations.
abstract: Editorial condemns Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan for failing to take action against Islamic State extremists besieging town of Kobani, Syria, and its Kurdish population; holds by remaining passive, Erdogan is seeking to weaken Kurds and force United States to help him oust Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; contends Erdogan thus is enabling Islamic State extremists, enraging Kurds in Turkey and threatening 50-plus-nation coalition United States has assembled.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Refusal to Fight ISIS Hurts the Kurds
headline.main: Mr. Erdogan’s Dangerous Game

snippet: The president says he won’t send troops. But war has its own logic.
lead_paragraph: The president says he won’t send troops. But war has its own logic.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Fredrik Logevall and author Gordon M Goldstein questions whether Pres Obama will allow America to be drawn into situation in Iraq and Syria similar to country's involvement in Vietnam; compares initial reluctance and political pressures faced by Pres Lyndon Johnson to those encountered by Obama; holds that Obama's gloomy realism may not save him from ill-advised military action, particularly once he has started down slippery slope of intervention.

headline.main: Will Syria Be Obama’s Vietnam?

snippet: Warplanes attacked 12 small refineries controlled by the Islamic State as part of an effort to target sources of the terrorist group’s financing.
lead_paragraph: Warplanes attacked 12 small refineries controlled by the Islamic State as part of an effort to target sources of the terrorist group’s financing.
abstract: International warplanes attack 12 small refineries in Syria controlled by Islamic State as part of effort to target sources of the terrorist group's financing; officials with the United States Central Command, which oversees American military operations in the Middle East, say refineries produce 300 to 500 barrels of oil daily, generating as much as $2 million per day in black-market oil sales for the group's operations.

headline.main: Warplanes Blast Militants’ Refineries in Syria, Targeting a Source of Cash

snippet: Creating a no-fly zone and stepping up combat air patrols would open a direct conflict with Syria, going beyond the U.S. mission against the Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Creating a no-fly zone and stepping up combat air patrols would open a direct conflict with Syria, going beyond the U.S. mission against the Islamic State.
abstract: Turkey, with United States continuing to pressure it to do more in fight against Islamic State, is hardening around idea of creating buffer zone along its frontier with Syria; American military planners are said to be looking at how to implement such a plan, which would require no-fly zone and stepped up combat patrols to take out Syrian air defense systems.

headline.main: Turkey Seeks Buffer Zone on the Border With Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Seeks Buffer Zone on the Border With Syria
